abstract: With the end of Andrew Lloyd Webber Week on “American Idol,” Fox breezed to a first place finish in the ratings on Wednesday. According to Nielsen’s estimates, 22.6 million viewers tuned in to the singing competition’s results episode at 9 p.m., easily dominating all other programming on the night.
lead_paragraph: With the end of Andrew Lloyd Webber Week on “American Idol,” Fox breezed to a first place finish in the ratings on Wednesday. According to Nielsen’s estimates, 22.6 million viewers tuned in to the singing competition’s results episode at 9 p.m., easily dominating all other programming on the night.

headline.main: Wednesday Ratings: Fox First, NBC Second
